member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage
member.summary: A ConnectedServiceConfigurator that shows completely custom UI in a single step.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectedServiceSinglePage class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of the page that is shown at the top of the dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the page that is shown at the top of the dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.IsFinishEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ConnectedServiceSinglePage.GetFinishedServiceInstanceAsync() can be invoked.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.View
member.summary: Gets or sets the WPF UI Element that describes the content of the page.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.GetFinishedServiceInstanceAsync
member.summary:
The method that is invoked when the user gestures that they are finished configuring the service and want their project updated.
This method will return a “finished” service instance that will be passed off to the Handler.
member.returns: A Task that returns the completed ConnectedServiceInstance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceSinglePage.CreateAuthenticatorAsync
member.summary: Creates the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator that allows users to log into the service.
member.returns: A Task that returns the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator instance, or null if the provider doesn't need to use authentication.
member.remarks:
The Connected Services core will call Dispose() on this instance when the dialog is closed.
The Connected Services core only uses the View property on the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator when using the ConnectedServiceSinglePage option. However, the other members may be helpful in your single page implementation. For example, the AuthenticationChanged and IsAuthenticated members inform your ConnectedServiceSinglePage class when the user logs in and out, or switches to a different account.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is already logged in or otherwise authenticated.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display when no instances are available because is 'false'.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Framework Element that should be displayed to allow the user to authenticate to the service.

member.summary: Notifies clients that the Authentication has changed.
member.param: The autentication event data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHyperlinkAuthenticator
member.summary: A ConnectedServiceAuthenticator that displays a hyperlink to allow the user to log in and out.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHyperlinkAuthenticator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectedServiceHyperlinkAuthenticator class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHyperlinkAuthenticator.AuthenticatedText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display when a user is logged in.

remarks.para: Should be null for non-user-based authentication schemes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHyperlinkAuthenticator.ChangeAuthenticationText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display to the user as a hint to change user or import credentials.

remarks.para: Typically "Import credentials..." for credentials based services, "Change user" or "Log off" for user-based services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHyperlinkAuthenticator.ChangeAuthenticationAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The action to take when the user chooses to switch users or import credentials.
member.param: CancellationToken used to cancel the authentication operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task that represents changing the authentication. The Task's result value indicates whether any change was made; this should be 'true' any time changes, and should also be 'true' if some aspect of the authentication has changed. (For example, if additional credentials are imported.)

remarks.para: This method is guaranteed to be called from the UI thread.

If an implementation desires to present blocking/modal UI, it may do so. If the authentication is changed before the method returns, the returned Task should be marked as completed (likely via Task.FromResult()).

If the implementation runs in the background, it may return an in-progress Task, and the Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the Task completes. In this case, the Connected Services code may cancel the task via the CancellationToken if the user closes the Conencted Services UI before the instance has been created.

If the implementation does not or cannot monitor the authentication, it may return null. In this case, the Connected Services code will do nothing until and unless a change notification is sent for the IsAuthenticated property.

If the implementation shows/handles any errors, the Task should not fault on them, nor throw them as Exceptions. If the returned Task completes in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstanceContext
member.summary: The context information given to ConnectedServiceHandler instances during AddServiceInstanceAsync.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstanceContext.ProjectHierarchy
member.summary: Gets the current project context where the service should be added.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstanceContext.ServiceInstance
member.summary: Gets the instance of the service to add to the project.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstanceContext.Logger
member.summary: Gets a logger that can be used to write any messages to the caller. This will include warnings of steps that did not succeed but can be fixed by the end user or errors that caused the operation to fail.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandler
member.summary: A MEF contract implemented by Connected Service authors in order to add a service instance reference to the project, including adding files, SDKs, and snippets.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandler.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectedServiceHandler class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceHandler.AddServiceInstanceAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstanceContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Given a connected service instance, add the necessary files and SDKs to the project in order to enable the given service.
member.param: The service instance that should be added to the project, including the project that it should be added to.
Cancellation Token to track cancellation.
member.returns: Returns a Task that can be waited on to be notified when the service instance has been added to the project or if anything went wrong.
member.remarks: The logger will write any status messages to the caller. This will include warnings and failures that occurred while trying to add a new file, SDK references, or injecting code.

member.summary: Gets a list of hyperlinks to display on the right side of the Connected Services "Selection" dialog under "Supported technologies".
member.returns: An IEnumerable of Tuple instances. The string is the text that gets displayed in the UI and the Uri is the location that is opened when the hyperlink is executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid
member.summary: A ConnectedServiceProvider service that shows a grid of instances, where a single instance can be chosen to add to the current project.
member.remarks: For any string property you can return null to use the default text. In order to not display text, return string.Empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectedServiceGrid class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display under the title of the dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.GridHeaderText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display directly above the grid.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.EnumeratingServiceInstancesText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display while Connected Services is attempting to retrieve the service instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.NoServiceInstancesText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display when no instances are available because the enumeration returned no instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ServiceInstanceNameLabelText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to display as the column header or label for the service instance name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ColumnMetadata
member.summary: Gets the keys and display strings for metadata to show as columns in the service instance list.

remarks.para: The Item1 field in the enumerable's Tuple is used as a key into the dictionary. The Item2 field is a localized display string to use as the column header.
The columns will be added in the order given after the column that shows the service instance's name. To change the display text for the service instance name, use the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.DetailMetadata
member.summary: Gets the keys and display strings for metadata to show in the property pane (to the right) when an instance is selected from the service instance list.

remarks.para: The Item1 field in the enumerable's Tuple is used as a key into the dictionary. The Item2 field is a localized display string to use as the field label.
The labels and fields will be displayed in the order given after the label and value for the service instance's name. To change the display text for the service instance name, use the property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.EnumerateServiceInstancesAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get a list of all of the service instances for the currently authenticated user, if any.
member.param: CancellationToken used to cancel the enumeration operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task that provides the available service instances.

remarks.para: This method is guaranteed to not be called from the UI thread. It will only be called on providers that return 'true' from if a ConnectedServiceAuthenticator is implemented.

The implementation's Task should complete only once the service instance Enumerable is fully available. The Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the returned Task completes, and the enumeration should not block on any network calls.

Because this is not called on the UI thread, the implementation should not show any errors. If need be, the Task should complete in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) and the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CreateAuthenticatorAsync
member.summary: Creates the ConnectedServiceAuthenticator that allows users to log into the service.
member.returns: The ConnectedServiceAuthenticator instance, or null if the provider doesn't need to use authentication.
member.remarks: The Connected Services core will call Dispose() on this instance when the dialog is closed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CanConfigureService
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this service can be configured through the connected service provider.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow configuration (or not without authentication, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use as the text of the control for the users to configure the service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Configure a service either through a dialog or linking to the configure web page.
member.param: CancellationToken used to cancel the configuration operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task for the configuration.

remarks.para: This method is guaranteed to be called from the UI thread.

If an implementation desires to present blocking/modal UI, it may do so. If the service is configured synchronously before the method returns, the returned Task should be marked as completed (for example, via Task.FromResult()).

If the implementation runs in the background, it may return an in-progress Task, and the Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the Task completes. In this case, the Connected Services code may cancel the task via the CancellationToken if the user closes the Conencted Services UI before the service has been configured.

If the implementation shows/handles any errors, the Task should not fault on them, nor throw them as Exceptions. If the returned Task completes in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CanCreateServiceInstance
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the provider can currently create a service instance.
member.remarks: Not all connected service providers will allow creation (or not without authentication, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CreateServiceInstanceText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use as the text of the control for the users to create a new instance.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow creation (or not without authentication, etc.) Providers may return null if creation is not supported at all.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CreateServiceInstanceAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the service.
member.param: CancellationToken used to cancel the creation operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task that provides the new service instance.

remarks.para:
This method is guaranteed to be called from the UI thread, and only on providers that return 'true' from
if a ConnectedServiceAuthenticator is implemented.

If an implementation desires to present blocking/modal UI, it may do so. If the service instance is created synchronously before the method returns, the returned Task should be marked as completed (likely via Task.FromResult()).

If the implementation runs in the background, it may return an in-progress Task, and the Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the Task completes. In this case, the Connected Services code may cancel the task via the CancellationToken if the user closes the Conencted Services UI before the instance has been created.

If the implementation does not or cannot monitor the creation of the new instance, it may return null. In this case, the Connected Services code will do nothing, and requires the user to manually refresh/enumerate the service instances to check for the newly- created instance.

If the implementation shows/handles any errors, the Task should not fault on them, nor throw them as Exceptions. If the returned Task completes in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.CanConfigureServiceInstance
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether instances of this service can be configured through the connected service provider.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow configuration of instances (or not without authentication, etc.)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceInstanceText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use as the text of the control for the users to configure an instance.

remarks.para: Not all connected service providers will allow configuration. Providers may return null if configuration is not supported.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceGrid.ConfigureServiceInstanceAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceInstance,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Configure a service instance either through a dialog or linking to the configure web page.
member.param: The service instance to configure.
CancellationToken used to cancel the configuration operation.
member.returns: Returns a Task for the configuration. The Task's result value indicates whether any changes were made to the instance.

remarks.para:
This method is guaranteed to be called from the UI thread, and only on providers that return 'true' from
if a ConnectedServiceAuthenticator is implemented.

If an implementation desires to present blocking/modal UI, it may do so. If the service instance is configured synchronously before the method returns, the returned Task should be marked as completed (for example, via Task.FromResult()).

If the implementation runs in the background, it may return an in-progress Task, and the Connected Services code will refresh the UI once the Task completes. In this case, the Connected Services code may cancel the task via the CancellationToken if the user closes the Conencted Services UI before the instance has been created.

If the implementation does not or cannot monitor the configuration of the instance, it may return null. In this case, the Connected Services code will do nothing, and requires the user to manually refresh/enumerate the service instances to check for changes to the configured instance.

If the implementation shows/handles any errors, the Task should not fault on them, nor throw them as Exceptions. If the returned Task completes in a Faulted state (such that the Exception member is non-null) the Connected Services UI will inform the user of the failure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata
member.summary: Metadata for finding, filtering, and describing ConnectedServices Providers and Handlers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata.ProviderId
member.summary: Gets the unique Provider ID for the provider/handler. This is used to match a provider with its handler.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata.AppliesTo
member.summary: Gets the "AppliesTo" query string for matching a connected service handler to a project's capabilities.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata.TargetPlatform
member.summary: Gets the "TargetPlatform" string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata.TargetPlatformVersion
member.summary: Gets the "TargetPlatformVersion" string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform version.
member.remarks: The syntax for specifying a version range is the same syntax as used in the .vsixmanifest InstallationTarget Version attribute. For more information, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee943167.aspx.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata.SupportedOutputType
member.summary: Gets the "OutputType" string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata.SupportedProjectTypes
member.summary: Gets the "ProjectTypes" query string for matching a connected service handler to a project's target platform.
member.remarks: The Guids can be in the following formats: "N": 32 digits: 00000000000000000000000000000000. "D": 32 digits separated by hyphens: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000. You can use the same syntax as the 'AppliesTo' attribute for building a query string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IConnectedServiceMetadata.CustomEvaluator
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a connected service handler contains its own logic to specify if it supports a project. If true, the handler should implement the IVsHierarchyCustomEvaluator interface.
member.remarks: For performance reasons, it is recommended to use the other properties if possible. That way fewer extensions need to be loaded.

The project to which to show the dialog for.

member.summary: A specific instance of a given service provided by the connected service provider.

member.summary: Gets or sets the human readable display name of the service instance.

member.summary: Gets metadata for the service instance used by the service provider and the service consumer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory
member.summary: The severity level of a message logged by ILogger.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Information
member.summary: The message can be shown to the user and is just for information. It is shown in the Output window and in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Debug
member.summary: The message is only to be used to help debug the application. It is shown only in the Output window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Warning
member.summary: Something non-critical went wrong or the user should be aware of a possible issue, but the operation can continue. It is shown in the Output window and in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory.Error
member.summary: Something went wrong and the operation can not continue. It is shown in the Output window and in the progress dialog.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceLogger
member.summary: A logging service which can be used to provide information to end user developers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceLogger.WriteMessageAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.LoggerMessageCategory,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Write a message to the log.
member.param: The severity level of the message.
A composite format string
An object array that contains zero or more objects to format.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceWizardPage.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this page is the currently shown page in the wizard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceWizardPage.HasErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this page has errors that the user needs to resolve.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceWizardPage.View
member.summary: Gets or sets the WPF UI Element that describes the content of the page.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceWizardPage.OnPageEnteringAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardEnteringArgs)
member.summary: OnPageEntering is called on a ConnectedServiceWizardPage when the wizard is navigating to the page.
member.param: Provides context on the page entering event.
member.returns: A NavigationEnabledState object that describes which navigation buttons should be enabled/disabled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.ConnectedServiceWizardPage.OnPageLeavingAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardLeavingArgs)
member.summary: OnPageLeaving is called on a ConnectedServiceWizardPage when the wizard is navigating away from the page.
member.param: Provides context on the page leaving event.
member.returns: A WizardNavigationResult that describes the success/failure state of the navigation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IVsHierarchyCustomEvaluator
member.summary: An optional interface that can be implemented by a ConnectedServiceHandler when it has an [ExportMetadata("CustomEvaluator", true)] attribute on it. This allows for any code to be written against the IVsHierarchy to indicate whether the handler supports the specified project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.IVsHierarchyCustomEvaluator.Evaluate(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy)
member.summary: Evaluates the IVsHierarchy and returns a value indicating whether the specified hierarchy is supported or not.
member.param: The project context to evaluate.
member.returns: true if the IVsHierarchy is supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.NavigationEnabledState
member.summary: A class that contains the navigation state for the Previous, Next, and Finish buttons of the wizard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.NavigationEnabledState.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NavigationEnabledState class.
member.param: A value indicating whether or not the Previous action should be enabled. A null value is used when the state shouldn't change from its current state.
A value indicating whether or not the Next action should be enabled. A null value is used when the state shouldn't change from its current state.
A value indicating whether or not the Finish action should be enabled. A null value is used when the state shouldn't change from its current state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.NavigationEnabledState.IsPreviousEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the Previous action should be enabled. A null value is used when the state shouldn't change from its current state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.NavigationEnabledState.IsNextEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the Next action should be enabled. A null value is used when the state shouldn't change from its current state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.NavigationEnabledState.IsFinishEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not the Finish action should be enabled. A null value is used when the state shouldn't change from its current state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardEnteringArgs
member.summary: The input arguments to the ConnectedServiceWizardPage.OnPageEnteringAsync method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardEnteringArgs.PreviousPage
member.summary: Gets the page that was previously selected, or null if this is the first entry into the wizard.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardLeavingArgs
member.summary: The input arguments to the ConnectedServiceWizardPage.OnPageLeavingAsync method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardLeavingArgs.NextPage
member.summary: Gets the page that will be selected, or null if the wizard is being finished.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardNavigationResult
member.summary: Contains the result state after leaving a page in the wizard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardNavigationResult.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WizardNavigationResult class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardNavigationResult.Success
member.summary: A successful WizardNavigationResult which allows the user to navigate away from the current page.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardNavigationResult.IsSuccess
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the navigation can succeed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardNavigationResult.ShowMessageBoxOnFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ErrorMessage should be shown to the user in a message box or not displayed at all.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.ConnectedServices.WizardNavigationResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the message that should be shown in a message box to the user.
